The words of the Teacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem:Introduction: Utter Futility
undefined “Futile! Futile!” laments the Teacher,“Absolutely futile! Everything is futile!”
undefined What benefit do people get from all the effortwhich they expend on earth?
undefined A generation comes and a generation goes,but the earth remains the same through the ages.
undefined The sun rises and the sun sets;it hurries away to a place from which it rises again.
undefined The wind goes to the south and circles around to the north;round and round the wind goes and on its rounds it returns.
undefined All the streams flow into the sea, but the sea is not full,and to the place where the streams flow, there they will flow again.
undefined All this monotony is tiresome; no one can bear to describe it:The eye is never satisfied with seeing, nor is the ear ever content with hearing.
undefined What exists now is what will be,and what has been done is what will be done;there is nothing truly new on earth.
undefined Is there anything about which someone can say, “Look at this! It is new!”?It was already done long ago, before our time.
undefined No one remembers the former events,nor will anyone remember the events that are yet to happen;they will not be remembered by the future generations.Futility of Secular Accomplishment
undefined I, the Teacher, have been king over Israel in Jerusalem.
undefined I decided to carefully and thoroughly examine all that has been accomplished on earth.I concluded: God has given people a burdensome task that keeps them occupied.
undefined I reflected on everything that is accomplished by man on earth,and I concluded: Everything he has accomplished is futile – like chasing the wind!
undefined What is bent cannot be straightened,and what is missing cannot be supplied.Futility of Secular Wisdom
undefined I thought to myself,“I have become much wiser than any of my predecessors who ruled over Jerusalem; I have acquired much wisdom and knowledge.”
undefined So I decided to discern the benefit of wisdom and knowledge over foolish behavior and ideas;however, I concluded that even this endeavor is like trying to chase the wind!
undefined For with great wisdom comes great frustration;whoever increases his knowledge merely increases his heartache.Futility of Self-Indulgent Pleasure
I thought to myself,“Come now, I will try self-indulgent pleasure to see if it is worthwhile.”But I found that it also is futile.
undefined I said of partying, “It is folly,”and of self-indulgent pleasure, “It accomplishes nothing!”

undefined I thought deeply about the effects of indulging myself with wine(all the while my mind was guiding me with wisdom)and the effects of behaving foolishly, so that I might discover what is profitablefor people to do on earth during the few days of their lives.Futility of Materialism
undefined I increased my possessions:I built houses for myself;I planted vineyards for myself.
undefined I designed royal gardens and parks for myself,and I planted all kinds of fruit trees in them.
undefined I constructed pools of water for myself,to irrigate my grove of flourishing trees.
undefined I purchased male and female slaves,and I owned slaves who were born in my house;I also possessed more livestock – both herds and flocks – than any of my predecessors in Jerusalem.

undefined I also amassed silver and gold for myself,as well as valuable treasures taken from kingdoms and provinces.I acquired male singers and female singers for myself,and what gives a man sensual delight – a harem of beautiful concubines!
undefined So I was far wealthier than all my predecessors in Jerusalem,yet I maintained my objectivity:

undefined I did not restrain myself from getting whatever I wanted;I did not deny myself anything that would bring me pleasure.So all my accomplishments gave me joy; this was my reward for all my effort.

undefined Yet when I reflected on everything I had accomplishedand on all the effort that I had expended to accomplish it,I concluded: “All these achievements and possessions are ultimately profitless – like chasing the wind!There is nothing gained from them on earth.”Wisdom is Better than Folly
undefined Next, I decided to consider wisdom, as well as foolish behavior and ideas.For what more can the king’s successor do than what the king has already done?
undefined I realized that wisdom is preferable to folly,just as light is preferable to darkness:
undefined The wise man can see where he is going, but the fool walks in darkness.Yet I also realized that the same fate happens to them both.

undefined So I thought to myself, “The fate of the fool will happen even to me!Then what did I gain by becoming so excessively wise?”So I lamented to myself,“The benefits of wisdom are ultimately meaningless!”
undefined For the wise man, like the fool, will not be remembered for very long,because in the days to come, both will already have been forgotten.Alas, the wise man dies – just like the fool!
undefined So I loathed life because what happens on earth seems awful to me;for all the benefits of wisdom are futile – like chasing the wind.Futility of Being a Workaholic
undefined So I loathed all the fruit of my effort,for which I worked so hard on earth,because I must leave it behind in the hands of my successor.
undefined Who knows if he will be a wise man or a fool?Yet he will be master over all the fruit of my laborfor which I worked so wisely on earth!This also is futile!
undefined So I began to despair about all the fruit of my laborfor which I worked so hard on earth.

undefined For a man may do his work with wisdom, knowledge, and skill;however, he must hand over the fruit of his labor as an inheritanceto someone else who did not work for it.This also is futile, and an awful injustice!Painful Days and Restless Nights
undefined What does a man acquire from all his laborand from the anxiety that accompanies his toil on earth?
undefined For all day long his work produces pain and frustration,and even at night his mind cannot relax!This also is futile!Enjoy Work and its Benefits
undefined There is nothing better for people than to eat and drink,and to find enjoyment in their work.I also perceived that this ability to find enjoyment comes from God.
undefined For no one can eat and drinkor experience joy apart from him.

undefined For to the one who pleases him, God gives wisdom, knowledge, and joy,but to the sinner, he gives the task of amassing wealth – only to give it to the one who pleases God.This task of the wicked is futile – like chasing the wind!A Time for All Events in Life
For everything there is an appointed time,and an appropriate time for every activity on earth:
undefined A time to be born, and a time to die;a time to plant, and a time to uproot what was planted;
undefined A time to kill, and a time to heal;a time to break down, and a time to build up;
undefined A time to weep, and a time to laugh;a time to mourn, and a time to dance.
undefined A time to throw away stones, and a time to gather stones;a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;
undefined A time to search, and a time to give something up as lost;a time to keep, and a time to throw away;
undefined A time to rip, and a time to sew;a time to keep silent, and a time to speak.
undefined A time to love, and a time to hate;a time for war, and a time for peace.Man is Ignorant of God’s Timing
undefined What benefit can a worker gain from his toil?
undefined I have observed the burdenthat God has given to people to keep them occupied.

undefined God has made everything fit beautifully in its appropriate time,but he has also placed ignorance in the human heartso that people cannot discover what God has ordained,from the beginning to the end of their lives.Enjoy Life in the Present
undefined I have concluded that there is nothing better for peoplethan to be happy and to enjoy themselves as long as they live,
undefined and also that everyone should eat and drink, and find enjoyment in all his toil,for these things are a gift from God.God’s Sovereignty
undefined I also know that whatever God does will endure forever;nothing can be added to it, and nothing taken away from it.God has made it this way, so that men will fear him.
undefined Whatever exists now has already been, and whatever will be has already been;for God will seek to do again what has occurred in the past.The Problem of Injustice and Oppression
undefined I saw something else on earth:In the place of justice, there was wickedness,and in the place of fairness, there was wickedness.
undefined I thought to myself, “God will judge both the righteous and the wicked;for there is an appropriate time for every activity,and there is a time of judgment for every deed.
undefined I also thought to myself, “It is for the sake of people,so God can clearly show them that they are like animals.
undefined For the fate of humans and the fate of animals are the same:As one dies, so dies the other; both have the same breath.There is no advantage for humans over animals,for both are fleeting.
undefined Both go to the same place,both come from the dust,and to dust both return.
undefined Who really knows if the human spirit ascends upward,and the animal’s spirit descends into the earth?
undefined So I perceived there is nothing better than for people to enjoy their work,because that is their reward;for who can show them what the future holds?Evil Oppression on Earth

So I again considered all the oppression that continually occurs on earth.This is what I saw:The oppressed were in tears, but no one was comforting them;no one delivers them from the power of their oppressors.
undefined So I considered those who are dead and gonemore fortunate than those who are still alive.
undefined But better than both is the one who has not been bornand has not seen the evil things that are done on earth.Labor Motivated by Envy
undefined Then I considered all the skillful work that is done:Surely it is nothing more than competition between one person and another.This also is profitless – like chasing the wind.
undefined The fool folds his hands and does no work,so he has nothing to eat but his own flesh.
undefined Better is one handful with some restthan two hands full of toil and chasing the wind.Labor Motivated by Greed
undefined So I again considered another futile thing on earth:

undefined A man who is all alone with no companion,he has no children nor siblings;yet there is no end to all his toil,and he is never satisfied with riches.He laments, “For whom am I toiling and depriving myself of pleasure?”This also is futile and a burdensome task!Labor is Beneficial When Its Rewards Are Shared
undefined Two people are better than one,because they can reap more benefit from their labor.
undefined For if they fall, one will help his companion up,but pity the person who falls down and has no one to help him up.
undefined Furthermore, if two lie down together, they can keep each other warm,but how can one person keep warm by himself?
undefined Although an assailant may overpower one person,two can withstand him.Moreover, a three-stranded cord is not quickly broken.Labor Motivated by Prestige-Seeking
undefined A poor but wise youth is better than an old and foolish kingwho no longer knows how to receive advice.
undefined For he came out of prison to become king,even though he had been born poor in what would become his kingdom.
undefined I considered all the living who walk on earth,as well as the successor who would arise in his place.
undefined There is no end to all the people nor to the past generations,yet future generations will not rejoice in him.This also is profitless and like chasing the wind.Rash Vows
Be careful what you do when you go to the temple of God;draw near to listen rather than to offer a sacrifice like fools,for they do not realize that they are doing wrong.
undefined Do not be rash with your mouth or hasty in your heart to bring up a matter before God,for God is in heaven and you are on earth!Therefore, let your words be few.
undefined Just as dreams come when there are many cares,so the rash vow of a fool occurs when there are many words.
undefined When you make a vow to God, do not delay in paying it.For God takes no pleasure in fools:Pay what you vow!
undefined It is better for you not to vowthan to vow and not pay it.
undefined Do not let your mouth cause you to sin,and do not tell the priest, “It was a mistake!”Why make God angry at youso that he would destroy the work of your hands?”
undefined Just as there is futility in many dreams,so also in many words.Therefore, fear God!Government Corruption

undefined The produce of the land is seized by all of them,even the king is served by the fields.
undefined The one who loves money will never be satisfied with money,he who loves wealth will never be satisfied with his income.This also is futile.
undefined When someone’s prosperity increases, those who consume it also increase;so what does its owner gain, except that he gets to see it with his eyes?
undefined The sleep of the laborer is pleasant – whether he eats little or much – but the wealth of the rich will not allow him to sleep.Materialism Thwarts Enjoyment of Life
undefined Here is a misfortune on earth that I have seen:Wealth hoarded by its owner to his own misery.
undefined Then that wealth was lost through bad luck;although he fathered a son, he has nothing left to give him.
undefined Just as he came forth from his mother's womb, naked will he return as he came,and he will take nothing in his hand that he may carry away from his toil.
undefined This is another misfortune:Just as he came, so will he go.What did he gain from toiling for the wind?
undefined Surely, he ate in darkness every day of his life,and he suffered greatly with sickness and anger.Enjoy the Fruit of Your Labor

undefined I have seen personally what is the only beneficial and appropriate course of action for people:to eat and drink, and find enjoyment in all their hard work on earthduring the few days of their life which God has given them,for this is their reward.

undefined To every man whom God has given wealth, and possessions,he has also given him the abilityto eat from them, to receive his reward and to find enjoyment in his toil;these things are the gift of God.
undefined For he does not think much about the fleeting days of his lifebecause God keeps him preoccupied with the joy he derives from his activity.Not Everyone Enjoys Life
Here is another misfortune that I have seen on earth,and it weighs heavily on people:

undefined God gives a man riches, property, and wealthso that he lacks nothing that his heart desires,yet God does not enable him to enjoy the fruit of his labor – instead, someone else enjoys it!This is fruitless and a grave misfortune.

undefined Even if a man fathers a hundred children and lives many years – even if he lives a long, long time, but cannot enjoy his prosperity – even if he were to live forever –  I would say, “A stillborn child is better off than he is!”
undefined Though the stillborn child came into the world for no reason and departed into darkness,though its name is shrouded in darkness,

undefined Whatever has happened was foreordained,and what happens to a person was also foreknown.It is useless for him to argue with God about his fatebecause God is more powerful than he is.
undefined The more one argues with words, the less he accomplishes.How does that benefit him?

undefined It is better to go to a funeralthan a feast.For death is the destiny of every person,and the living should take this to heart.
undefined Sorrow is better than laughter,because sober reflection is good for the heart.
undefined The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning,but the heart of fools is in the house of merrymaking.Frivolous Living Versus Wisdom
undefined It is better for a person to receive a rebuke from those who are wisethan to listen to the song of fools.

undefined Surely oppression can turn a wise person into a fool;likewise, a bribe corrupts the heart.
undefined The end of a matter is better than its beginning;likewise, patience is better than pride.
undefined Do not let yourself be quickly provoked,for anger resides in the lap of fools.
undefined Do not say, “Why were the old days better than these days?”for it is not wise to ask that.Wisdom Can Lengthen One’s Life
undefined Wisdom, like an inheritance, is a good thing;it benefits those who see the light of day.

undefined Consider the work of God:For who can make straight what he has bent?

undefined In times of prosperity be joyful,but in times of adversity consider this:God has made one as well as the other,so that no one can discover what the future holds.Exceptions to the Law of Retribution

undefined Do not be excessively wicked and do not be a fool;otherwise you might die before your time.
undefined It is best to take hold of one warning without letting go of the other warning;for the one who fears God will follow both warnings.Wisdom Needed Because No One is Truly Righteous
undefined Wisdom gives a wise person more protection than ten rulers in a city.
undefined For there is not one truly righteous person on the earthwho continually does good and never sins.
undefined Also, do not pay attention to everything that people say;otherwise, you might even hear your servant cursing you.

So I reflected on all this, attempting to clear it all up.I concluded that the righteous and the wise, as well as their works, are in the hand of God;whether a person will be loved or hated – no one knows what lies ahead.

undefined Everyone shares the same fate – the righteous and the wicked,the good and the bad,the ceremonially clean and unclean,those who offer sacrifices and those who do not.What happens to the good person, also happens to the sinner;what happens to those who make vows, also happens to those who are afraid to make vows.

undefined This is the unfortunate fact about everything that happens on earth:the same fate awaits everyone.In addition to this, the hearts of all people are full of evil,and there is folly in their hearts during their lives – then they die.Better to Be Poor but Alive than Rich but Dead
undefined But whoever is among the living has hope;a live dog is better than a dead lion.
undefined For the living know that they will die, but the dead do not know anything;they have no further reward – and even the memory of them disappears.
undefined What they loved, as well as what they hated and envied, perished long ago,and they no longer have a part in anything that happens on earth.Life is Brief, so Cherish its Joys
undefined Go, eat your food with joy,and drink your wine with a happy heart,because God has already approved your works.
undefined Let your clothes always be white,and do not spare precious ointment on your head.

undefined Enjoy life with your beloved wife during all the days of your fleeting lifethat God has given you on earth during all your fleeting days;for that is your reward in life and in your burdensome work on earth.

undefined Whatever you find to do with your hands,do it with all your might,because there is neither work nor planning nor knowledge nor wisdom in the grave,the place where you will eventually go.Wisdom Cannot Protect against Seemingly Chance Events

undefined Again, I observed this on the earth:the race is not always won by the swiftest,the battle is not always won by the strongest;prosperity does not always belong to those who are the wisest,wealth does not always belong to those who are the most discerning,nor does success always come to those with the most knowledge – for time and chance may overcome them all.

undefined Surely, no one knows his appointed time!Like fish that are caught in a deadly net, and like birds that are caught in a snare – just like them, all people are ensnared at an unfortunate time that falls upon them suddenly.Most People Are Not Receptive to Wise Counsel
undefined This is what I also observed about wisdom on earth,and it is a great burden to me:
undefined There was once a small city with a few men in it,and a mighty king attacked it, besieging it and building strong siege works against it.
undefined However, a poor but wise man lived in the city,and he could have delivered the city by his wisdom,but no one listened to that poor man.
undefined So I concluded that wisdom is better than might,but a poor man’s wisdom is despised; no one ever listens to his advice.Wisdom versus Fools, Sin, and Folly
undefined The words of the wise are heard in quiet,more than the shouting of a ruler is heard among fools.
undefined Wisdom is better than weapons of war,but one sinner can destroy much that is good.

undefined A wise person’s good sense protects him,but a fool’s lack of sense leaves him vulnerable.
undefined Even when a fool walks along the road he lacks sense,and shows everyone what a fool he is.
undefined If the anger of the ruler flares up against you, do not resign from your position,for a calm response can undo great offenses.
undefined I have seen another misfortune on the earth:It is an error a ruler makes.
undefined Fools are placed in many positions of authority,while wealthy men sit in lowly positions.
undefined I have seen slaves on horsebackand princes walking on foot like slaves.Wisdom is Needed to Avert Dangers in Everyday Life
undefined One who digs a pit may fall into it,and one who breaks through a wall may be bitten by a snake.
undefined One who quarries stones may be injured by them;one who splits logs may be endangered by them.
undefined If an iron axhead is blunt and a workman does not sharpen its edge,he must exert a great deal of effort;so wisdom has the advantage of giving success.
undefined If the snake should bite before it is charmed,the snake charmer is in trouble.Words and Works of Wise Men and Fools
undefined The words of a wise person win him favor,but the words of a fool are self-destructive.
undefined At the beginning his words are foolishand at the end his talk is wicked madness,
undefined yet a fool keeps on babbling.No one knows what will happen;who can tell him what will happen in the future?
undefined The toil of a stupid fool wears him out,because he does not even know the way to the city.The Problem with Foolish Rulers
undefined Woe to you, O land, when your king is childish,and your princes feast in the morning!
undefined Blessed are you, O land, when your king is the son of nobility,and your princes feast at the proper time – with self-control and not in drunkenness.
undefined Because of laziness the roof caves in,and because of idle hands the house leaks.
undefined Feasts are made for laughter,and wine makes life merry,but money is the answer for everything.

undefined Do not curse a king even in your thoughts,and do not curse the rich while in your bedroom;for a bird might report what you are thinking,or some winged creature might repeat your words.Ignorance of the Future Demands Diligence in the Present
Send your grain overseas,for after many days you will get a return.
undefined Divide your merchandise among seven or even eight investments,for you do not know what calamity may happen on earth.
undefined If the clouds are full of rain, they will empty themselves on the earth,and whether a tree falls to the south or to the north, the tree will lie wherever it falls.
undefined He who watches the wind will not sow,and he who observes the clouds will not reap.
undefined Just as you do not know the path of the wind,or how the bones form in the womb of a pregnant woman,so you do not know the work of God who makes everything.

undefined Sow your seed in the morning,and do not stop working until the evening;for you do not know which activity will succeed – whether this one or that one, or whether both will prosper equally.Life Should Be Enjoyed Because Death is Inevitable
undefined Light is sweet,and it is pleasant for a person to see the sun.

undefined So, if a man lives many years, let him rejoice in them all,but let him remember that the days of darkness will be many – all that is about to come is obscure.Enjoy Life to the Fullest under the Fear of God

undefined Rejoice, young man, while you are young,and let your heart cheer you in the days of your youth.Follow the impulses of your heart and the desires of your eyes,but know that God will judge your motives and actions.
undefined Banish emotional stress from your mind.and put away pain from your body;for youth and the prime of life are fleeting.Fear God Now Because Old Age and Death Come Quickly
So remember your Creator in the days of your youth – before the difficult days come,and the years draw near when you will say, “I have no pleasure in them”;
undefined before the sun and the light of the moon and the stars grow dark,and the clouds disappear after the rain;

undefined when those who keep watch over the house begin to tremble,and the virile men begin to stoop over,and the grinders begin to cease because they grow few,and those who look through the windows grow dim,

undefined and the dust returns to the earth as it was,and the life’s breath returns to God who gave it.Concluding Refrain: Qoheleth Restates His Thesis
undefined “Absolutely futile!” laments the Teacher,“All of these things are futile!”Concluding Epilogue: Qoheleth’s Advice is Wise
undefined Not only was the Teacher wise,but he also taught knowledge to the people;he carefully evaluated and arranged many proverbs.
undefined The Teacher sought to find delightful words,and to write accurately truthful sayings.
undefined The words of the sages are like prods,and the collected sayings are like firmly fixed nails;they are given by one shepherd.Concluding Exhortation: Fear God and Obey His Commands!
undefined Be warned, my son, of anything in addition to them.There is no end to the making of many books,and much study is exhausting to the body.
undefined Having heard everything, I have reached this conclusion:Fear God and keep his commandments,because this is the whole duty of man.
